III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Sometime over the past two years, a staff member choked and hit
a youth at the facility. The incident was investigated resulting in no
findings and the staff member kept their job.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school by MDHHS
worker on October 4, 2024. Youth A said she was previously
placed at Bay Pines Center. Youth A said she had heard from
other youth that Staff 1 had “choked a boy” before she was placed
at the facility. Youth A denied seeing Staff 1 choke any youth at
the facility. Youth A said other youth on her pod had reported this
and it was not any of the boy youth that told her it had occurred.
Youth A denied having any concerns or issues with Staff 1 while
placed at Bay Pines Center.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at Wolverine Human
Services by MDHHS worker on October 4, 2024. Youth B said
he was previously placed at Bay Pines Center but was unable to
recall when or how long he was placed there. Youth B said he did
not recall any staff member’s names and denied knowing Staff 1.
Youth B said he was never harmed while at Bay Pines Center.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at Pine Rest by MDHHS
worker on October 4, 2024; as well as via TEAMS on October
17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C said he
was previously placed at Bay Pines Center “a few times” but was
unable to remember the exact dates. During this interview Youth
C reported several concerns regarding Bay Pines Center. Youth C
said the staff at Bay Pines Center forgot to administer his
medications. This was investigated in 2024C0000843SI and
therefore, not addressed in this SI. Youth C said the staff at Bay
Pines Center all treated him poorly and did not care about him.
This was investigated in 2024C0000843SI and therefore, not
addressed in this SI. Youth C said he was on suicide status and
staff did not allow him to shower nor did they complete the
required checks on him. This was investigated in
2024C0000843SI and therefore, not addressed in this SI. Youth
C said he was placed in handcuffs for many hours causing pain to
2

his wrists. This was investigated in 2024C0000843SI and
therefore, not addressed in this SI.
Youth C said while at Bay Pines Center Staff 2 was a staff
member that had restrained him and during a restraint had placed
him in a “headlock” or “chokehold”. Youth C said he did not lose
consciousness during the incident and noted it lasted “about 10
seconds”. Youth C said he was unsure of when this occurred but
guessed it was around when he was 13 years old. Youth C said
Staff 2 was trying to get him to step into his room and he refused
and dropped to the ground and began crawling away and Staff 2
grabbed him from behind and placed him in a chokehold, noting
now it was only 5 seconds. Youth C said he was not injured and
was not able to recall if anyone else witnessed the incident.
Youth C said during a different situation, he was banging on his
bedroom door to come out and Staff 3 was upset that he kept
banging on his door so entered Youth C’s room, grabbed him, and
swung him around and into a bookshelf. Youth C said he almost
hit his head but did not, noting he was not injured during the
incident. Youth C said he does not remember if anyone witnessed
this incident.
Youth C said he did recall Staff 1, stating he did not have any
issues with him. Youth C denied being choked, kicked, hit, or
assaulted in anyway by Staff 1. Youth C denied seeing Staff 1
choke, hit, kick, or assault any other youth.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D
said she has been placed at Bay Pines Center for approximately
two and a half years and had been at the facility when the facility
had a male unit. Youth D said she has never seen any restraints
with Staff 1 and any male youth. Youth D said she has never
heard of Staff 1 choking a male youth or any other youth in the
facility. Youth D said she has never witnessed Staff 1 choking any
youth at the facility and denied any concerns with Staff 1.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth E
said she was placed at Bay Pines Center from April to May of
2023 in the detention program and then placed on June 2, 2023,
in the treatment program. Youth E said she did not have any
contact with any of the male youth at the facility. Youth E said she
has never seen or heard of Staff 1 choking any youth at the
facility. Youth E said she does not have any concerns about Staff
1’s interactions with the youth in the facility.
3

Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth F said she has been at the facility since May 19, 2023.
Youth F said Youth C was placed at the facility and moved with
her group for a period of time last year. Youth F said Staff 1 was
on the unit “on and off” but not assigned to work her unit. Youth F
said she has never seen Staff 1 choke Youth C or any other
youth. Youth F said Youth C never disclosed being choked by any
staff. Youth F said Staff 2 also works with her and she feels he is
a “good staff” and has never seen or heard of him choking any
youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he worked with
both Staff 2 and Staff 3 in his time at Bay Pines Center. Staff 1
said he also remembered both Youth B and Youth C. Staff 1 said
he was involved in restraints with both Youth B and Youth C
however they were always conducted with other staff assisting
and present. Staff 1 denied ever choking either Youth B, Youth C,
or any youth at the facility. Staff 1 said the only time he would ever
have his hands near a youth’s neck would be if he was attempting
to control their head from youth banging their heads or spitting on
staff and the need to apply the spit shield, however even in those
situations he would never have touched the youth’s neck. Staff 1
noted that when Youth C was in restraints, he would often yell out
different allegations against staff that were not true. Staff 1 denied
ever seeing or hearing of Staff 2 choking Youth C or any other
youth. Staff 1 denied ever seeing or hearing of Staff 3 slamming
Youth C or any other youth against a bookshelf. Staff 1 said he
also handles all of the grievances for the youth at the facility and
has never had anything reported through that process about youth
being choked or slammed into bookshelves.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he worked with
Youth C several years ago and had to restrain him “multiple times”
due to self-harm behaviors. Staff 2 said whenever Youth C was
restrained a staff assistance call was done and several other staff
would be assisting or present during the restraint. Staff 2 denied
ever placing Youth C into a chokehold or putting him in any
restraint where he held him near or on the neck area. Staff 2 said
he has also worked with Staff 1 and Staff 3 and denied ever
seeing either of them place youth in chokeholds or throw youth
into bookshelves. Staff 2 said he has never heard any youth allege
Staff 1 has harmed them in any way. Staff 2 said he had never
4

heard anyone make allegations regarding Staff 3, however noted
he has not worked at the facility in “years”.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he no longer
works at Bay Pines Center however does remember Youth C.
Staff 3 said he was involved in “multiple” restraints with Youth C,
however denied ever throwing Youth C into a bookshelf. Staff 3
said anytime he restrained any youth at the facility a “staff
assistance” call would be made where several staff members
would come to assist and be present during restraints. Staff 3 said
Therapist was his supervisor when he left the facility. Staff 3 said
he also worked with Staff 1 and denied ever seeing or hearing of
him choke any youth.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Therapist said she has worked at the facility with Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3, as well as worked with Youth B and Youth C.
Therapist said she has never seen or heard of Staff 1 choking a
youth. Therapist said she never seen or heard of Staff 2 choking
Youth C or any other youth. Therapist said she never seen or
heard of Staff 3 throwing Youth C or any other youth against a
bookshelf. Therapist said Youth C calls Bay Pines Center almost
daily to talk with staff and herself and has never mentioned the
allegations regarding Staff 2 or Staff 3.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor said he has worked at the facility for many years and
has worked with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. Supervisor said he
has never seen or heard of Staff 1 choking any youth at the
facility. Supervisor said he has never seen or heard of Staff 2
choking Youth C or any other youth. Supervisor said he has never
seen or heard of Staff 3 throwing Youth C or any other youth
against a bookshelf.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Director
said he has worked with Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 as both a director
and a supervisor at the facility. Director denied ever seeing or
hearing Staff 1 choke any youth at the facility, including Youth B
and Youth C. Director denied ever hearing or seeing Staff 2
choking Youth C or any other youth at the facility. Director denied
ever hearing or seeing Staff 3 throwing Youth C or any other youth
into a bookshelf.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS Incident Reports were reviewed that included
Staff 1, male youth, and restraints for the timeframe of
October 1, 2021, to October 6, 2022, which was the
timeframe of Youth A’s placement at Bay Pines Center with
male youth being at the facility. There were no incident
reports that indicated Staff 1 choked any youth.
• MiSACWIS Incident Reports were reviewed that included
Youth C and Staff 2. There were thirteen incident reports
between December 20, 2018, and March 13, 2023. None of
the incident reports noted Youth C being choked by Staff 2
or injured by Staff 2.
• MiSACWIS Incident Reports were reviewed that included
Youth C and Staff 3. There were seven incident reports
between December 26, 2018, and May 6, 2019. None of
the incident reports noted Youth C being thrown into a
bookshelf or injured by Staff 3.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, there is no evidence that Staff 1 choked a youth at Bay
Pines Center.
Further, the agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation that Staff 2 choked Youth C,
or Staff 3 threw Youth C against a bookshelf.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
